sen.j: 桑山 玉洲（くわやま ぎょくしゅう、延享3年（1746年） - 寛政11年4月13日 (旧暦)（1799年5月17日））は、江戸時代中期の文人画・美術評論家。
sen.e: Gyokushu KUWAYAMA (1746 – May 17, 1799) was a painter in the Southern Chinese style and art critic of the mid-Edo period in Japan.
Gyokushu KUWAYAMA (1746 – May 17, 1799) was a painter in the Southern Chinese style and art critic of the mid-Edo period in Japan.
Gyokushu KUWAYAMA (1746 – May 17, 1799) was a painter in the Southern Chinese style and art critic of the mid-Edo period in Japan.

sen.j: 祇園南海・野呂介石とともに紀州三大南画家と称される。
sen.e: Gyokushu along with Nankai GION and Kaiseki NORO, were known as the 3 great Southern Chinese style artists of the Kishu area.
Gyokushu along with Nankai GION and Kaiseki NORO, were known as the 3 great Southern Chinese style artists of the Kishu area.
Gyokushu along with Nankai GION and Kaiseki NORO, were known as the 3 great Southern Chinese style artists of the Kishu area.

sen.j: 紀伊国（現在の和歌山県）出身。
sen.e: Born in Kii Province (present day Wakayama Prefecture).
Born in Kii Province (present day Wakayama Prefecture).
Born in Ki Province (present day Wakayama Prefecture).

sen.j: 名は政近をはじめに嗣幹、嗣粲、嗣燦と改め、字を白瑞、子戔、明夫、通称は茂兵次。
sen.e: Gyokushu started off changing his name to 嗣幹、嗣粲 嗣燦 and then to 白瑞、子戔、Akio as well as using a pen name `茂兵`.
Gyokushu started off changing his name to 嗣幹、嗣粲 嗣燦 and then to 白瑞、子戔、Akio as well as using a pen name `茂兵`.
Gyokushu started off changing his name to 政近, 嗣幹, 嗣粲, 嗣燦, and also used several bynames, 白瑞, 子戔, 明夫 while commonly known as '茂兵次'

sen.j: 号 (称号)は玉洲の他に明光居士、珂雪漁人、玉津嶋漁人、蘆泮、また堂号は鶴跡園、珂雪堂、聴雨堂、勧耕舎など。
sen.e: He subsequently went on to use multiple sobriquets and pen names.
He subsequently went on to use multiple sobriquets and pen names.
He subsequently went on to use multiple sobriquets and pen names.

sen.j: 延享3年（1746年）、廻船業・両替商の桑山昌澄の子として紀伊国和歌浦に生まれる。
sen.e: He was born In 1746 in Wakanoura in Kii Province the son of桑山昌澄 the owner of a small cargo vessel and money lender.
He was born In 1746 in Wakanoura in Kii Province the son of桑山昌澄 the owner of a small cargo vessel and money lender.
He was born in 1746 in Wakanoura in Ki Province the son of Masuzumi KUWAYAMA the owner of a small cargo vessel and money lender.

sen.j: 桑山氏の祖は元々武家であった。
sen.e: Ancestors of the Kuwayama clan were formerly samurai.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Ancestors of the Kuwayama clan were formerly samurai.
Ancestors of the Kuwayama clan were formerly samurai.

sen.j: 天正13年（1585年）に和歌山城代となり3万石を拝領した桑山重晴を家祖とする。
sen.e: In 1585 ancestors (Shigeharu KUWAYANA) of the family became holders of Wakayama-jo castle and received 30,000 koku of tributes
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: In 1585 ancestors (Shigeharu KUWAYANA) of the family became holders of Wakayama-jo castle and received 30,000 koku of tributes
In 1585, Shigeharu KUWAYANA, founder of the family became the keeper of Wakayama-jo castle and received 30,000 koku of tributes

sen.j: いつの頃から武士を辞め、父昌澄の代には江戸・武蔵国神奈川宿などに支店をもつ商家となって隆盛していた。
sen.e: At some stage, life as samurai was abandoned and in stead, Gyokushu`s father's (Masazumi) generation became prosperous as merchants with shops and accommodation in Kanagawa in Musashi Province.
At some stage, life as samurai was abandoned and in stead, Gyokushu`s father's (Masazumi) generation became prosperous as merchants with shops and accommodation in Kanagawa in Musashi Province.
At some stage, life as samurai was abandoned and in stead, Gyokushu's father's (Masazumi) generation became prosperous as merchants with shops and accommodation in Kanagawa in Musashi Province.

sen.j: 玉洲は7歳のとき父を亡くし、一族の援助を得て家業を継いだ。
sen.e: When Gyokushu was 7 years old his father died and, to help support his family he took over his father's family business.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: When Gyokushu was 7 years old his father died and, to help support his family he took over his father's family business.
When Gyokushu was 7 years old his father died, after that he took over his father's family business with the support of his clan.

sen.j: 19歳の時苗字帯刀を許される。
sen.e: At age 19 he received permission to wear a sword.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: At age 19 he received permission to wear a sword.
At age 19 he received permission to adopt a surname and wear a pair of swords.

sen.j: 明和5年（1768年）に神奈川の支店を焼失。
sen.e: In 1768 his Kanagawa branch building was destroyed by fire,
In 1768 his Kanagawa branch building was destroyed by fire,
In 1768 his Kanagawa branch building was destroyed by fire,

sen.j: それと相前後して持船3艘が難破し大損害を受け事業が傾いた。
sen.e: Also around that time three of his boats were shipwrecked and his business interests lurched towards heavy losses.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Also around that time three of his boats were shipwrecked and his business interests lurched towards heavy losses.
Also around that time three of his boats were shipwrecked and his business interests lurched towards heavy losses.

sen.j: しかし、直後に開墾事業を興し大きな成果を挙げた。
sen.e: However, soon after he enjoyed big returns from cultivating new land.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: However, soon after he enjoyed big returns from cultivating new land.
However, soon after he enjoyed big returns from cultivating new land.

sen.j: 青年期を実業家として過ごしたが、やがて農業に転向する。
sen.e: He made his way as a young entrepreneur however, over time he shifted to agriculture.
He made his way as a young entrepreneur however, over time he shifted to agriculture.
He made his way as a young entrepreneur however, over time he shifted to agriculture.

sen.j: 画業は、19歳のときに中国絵画の模写などを行っていた。
sen.e: As for painting, he executed some copies of Chinese style paintings when he was 19 years old.
As for painting, he executed some copies of Chinese style paintings when he was 19 years old.
As for painting, he executed some copies of Chinese style paintings when he was 19 years old.

sen.j: 既にこの頃から江戸や京都で旺盛に書画収集を行っていた。
sen.e: By that stage he was already actively collecting paintings and calligraphy in Kyoto and Edo.
By that stage he was already actively collecting paintings and calligraphy in Kyoto and Edo.
By that stage he was already actively collecting paintings and calligraphy in Kyoto and Edo.

sen.j: その後江戸の雪舟派とされる桜井雪館に手ほどきを受け、のちに狩野派にも触れたようだが共に大いに失望させられた。
sen.e: Subsequently he received his first rudimentary introduction to painting in Edo at the hands of Sekkan SAKURAI of the Sesshu School of painting, and later went on came into contact with the Kano School but both were left disappointed.

Subsequently he received his first rudimentary introduction to painting in Edo at the hands of Sekkan SAKURAI of the Sesshu School of painting, and later went on came into contact with the Kano School but both were left disappointed.

Subsequently he received his first rudimentary introduction to painting in Edo at the hands of Sekkan SAKURAI of the Sesshu School of painting, and later went on came into contact with the Kano School but both were left disappointed.

sen.j: 発表されなかった画論書『嗣幹画論』においてこれらを手厳しく排撃している。
sen.e: Gyokushu`s unpublished art critique (entitled `嗣幹画論`) was severely criticized.
Gyokushu`s unpublished art critique (entitled `嗣幹画論`) was severely criticized.
Gyokushu's unpublished art critique (entitled "嗣幹画論") criticized them harshly.
sen.cmt: ダブルクォートwas severely criticized → criticized them harshly

sen.j: 26歳の頃、開墾開発事業が一区切りつき、画業に本腰を入れはじめる。
sen.e: Around age 26 he completely ceased developing and cultivating new land and began to seriously set about painting.
Around age 26 he completely ceased developing and cultivating new land and began to seriously set about painting.
Around age 26 he completely ceased developing and cultivating new land and began to seriously set about painting.

sen.j: 柳沢淇園や清人の伊孚九、沈南蘋に私淑し花鳥画を画いた。
sen.e: KUWAYAMA painted flowers and birds and admired painters Kien YANAGISAWA and Chinese Qing dynasty personality Fukyu I (aka. I Fuzhou (伊孚九)) and, Nanbin SHIN (aka Shen Nanpin/Shen Quan (沈南蘋)).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: KUWAYAMA painted flowers and birds and admired painters Kien YANAGISAWA and Chinese Qing dynasty personality Fukyu I (aka. I Fuzhou (伊孚九)) and, Nanbin SHIN (aka Shen Nanpin/Shen Quan (沈南蘋)).
KUWAYAMA painted flowers and birds and admired painters Kien YANAGISAWA and Chinese Qing dynasty personality Fukyu I (aka. I Fuzhou [伊孚九]) and, Nanbin SHIN (aka Shen Nanpin/Shen Quan [沈南蘋]).

sen.j: 大坂の池大雅、高芙蓉、木村兼葭堂などとの交流から山水画に自らの本領を見いだす。
sen.e: However, through the influence of interactions with members of the Osaka school (Taika IKENO, (aka Taika IKE), Kenkado KIMURA etc) KUWAYAMA found his own milieu was landscapes.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: However, through the influence of interactions with members of the Osaka school (Taika IKENO, (aka Taika IKE), Kenkado KIMURA etc) KUWAYAMA found his own milieu was landscapes.
However, through the influence of interactions with members of the Osaka school (Taika IKENO, (aka Taika IKE), Kenkado KIMURA etc) KUWAYAMA found his own milieu was landscapes.

sen.j: このように画をひとりの師について永く学ぶことは無く、ほぼ独学であった。
sen.e: As such, Gyokushu was largely self-taught having painted for a long time without studying under a single master.
As such, Gyokushu was largely self-taught having painted for a long time without studying under a single master.
As such, Gyokushu was largely self-taught having painted for a long time without studying under a single master.

sen.j: 学問は儒学者であり漢詩人の細合半斎を師と仰ぎ、31歳のとき半斎像を画いたが、これが玉洲の唯一の肖像画である。
sen.e: Studying Confucianism, KUWAYAMA sought instruction from Hansai HOSOAI (a poet who wrote in the Chinese style) and at age 31 painted a portrait of HANSAI which was however, KUWAYAMA`s only known rendition of a portrait.

Studying Confucianism, KUWAYAMA sought instruction from Hansai HOSOAI (a poet who wrote in the Chinese style) and at age 31 painted a portrait of HANSAI which was however, KUWAYAMA`s only known rendition of a portrait.

Studying Confucianism, KUWAYAMA sought instruction from Hansai HOSOAI (a poet who wrote in the Chinese style) and at age 31 painted a portrait of HANSAI which was however, KUWAYAMA's only known rendition of a portrait.

sen.j: その後、山水画とともに真景図を精力的に制作している。
sen.e: Subsequently, poured his energies into producing landscapes and realistic scenes.
Subsequently, poured his energies into producing landscapes and realistic scenes.
Subsequently, poured his energies into producing landscapes and realistic scenes.

sen.j: 50歳の時紀州のひとつ下の後輩である野呂介石らとともに牟婁郡に遊歴し、この経験をもとに『熊野奇勝図巻』や『那智滝図』などの傑作を遺した。
sen.e: At age 50 together with Kaiseki NORO (a younger associate from Kishu) and others, Gyokushu traveled to the hamlet of Mura and from the experience produced some of his best work: 'Kumano Scenic Folio ' and 'Nachinotaki Waterfall Folio'.

At age 50 together with Kaiseki NORO (a younger associate from Kishu) and others, Gyokushu traveled to the hamlet of Mura and from the experience produced some of his best work: 'Kumano Scenic Folio ' and 'Nachinotaki Waterfall Folio'.

At age 50 together with Kaiseki NORO (a younger associate from Kishu) and others, Gyokushu traveled to Muro-gun and from the experience produced some of his best work: "Kumano Scenic Folio" and "Nachinotaki Waterfall Folio."

sen.j: 玉洲は当時評論家として知られ、寛政2年（1790年）に画論『画苑鄙言』を著し長島藩主増山正賢に献上した。
sen.e: Gyokushu was known in his day as a commentator and his 1790 art critique `Country Gardens Commentary` was dedicated to Masakata MASHIYAMA, the prominent head of the Nagashima domain.
Gyokushu was known in his day as a commentator and his 1790 art critique `Country Gardens Commentary` was dedicated to Masakata MASHIYAMA, the prominent head of the Nagashima domain.
Gyokushu was known in his day as a commenter and his 1790 art critique "Country Gardens Commentary" was dedicated to Masakata MASHIYAMA, the lord of the Nagashima domain.

sen.j: これには該博な知識を元に文人画論を展開している。
sen.e: Based on his profound knowledge, Gyokushu expanded the debate on the Southern Chinese style of painting.
Based on his profound knowledge, Gyokushu expanded the debate on the Southern Chinese style of painting.
Based on his profound knowledge, Gyokushu expanded the debate on the Southern Chinese style of painting.

sen.j: その年の秋には『玉洲画趣』を脱稿している。
sen.e: In the autumn of that year he completed the manuscript of 'Picturesque Gyokushu'.
In the autumn of that year he completed the manuscript of 'Picturesque Gyokushu'.
In the autumn of that year he completed the manuscript of "Picturesque Gyokushu."

sen.j: 日本の文人画論は玉洲によって完成されたといえる。
sen.e: It can be said that Japanese art critique was made complete by Gyokushu.
It can be said that Japanese art critique was made complete by Gyokushu.
It can be said that Japanese art critique was made complete by Gyokushu.
Died April 13, 1799
Died April 13, 1799
Died April 13, 1799

sen.j: 享年54。
sen.e: Age at death: 54.
Age at death: 54.
Died at the age of 54.

sen.j: 墓所は和歌浦中一丁目の宗善寺。
sen.e: Gyokushu`s gravesite is located at Sozen-ji Temple, Wakauranaka 1-chome
Gyokushu`s gravesite is located at Sozen-ji Temple, Wakauranaka 1-chome
Gyokushu's gravesite is located at Sozen-ji Temple, Wakauranaka 1-chome

sen.j: 没後、遺稿『絵事鄙言』が木村蒹葭堂によって刊行された。
sen.e: After death, his manuscript 'Countryside Painting Commentary' were posthumously published by the artist Kenkado KIMURA.
After death, his manuscript 'Countryside Painting Commentary' were posthumously published by the artist Kenkado KIMURA.
After death, his manuscript "Countryside Painting Commentary" were posthumously published by the artist Kenkado KIMURA.

sen.j: この中で俵屋宗達や尾形光琳を日本の南画であると鋭い評論を述べ評価された。
sen.e: It is thought that in this work there is astute critique of Japanese Southern Chinese style painters Sotatsu TAWARAYA and Korin OGATA.
It is thought that in this work there is astute critique of Japanese Southern Chinese style painters Sotatsu TAWARAYA and Korin OGATA.
It is thought that in this work there is astute critique of Japanese Southern Chinese style painters Sotatsu TAWARAYA and Korin OGATA.
